column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Kure
#Text=Kure ( 呉 ) is a port city in Hiroshima prefecture , Japan .
#Text=It is the third largest city in the prefecture by population , after Hiroshima and Fukuyama .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The nearest airport is Hiroshima Airport , which is less than an hour away by car along the Higashihiroshima-Kure Expressway .

#Text=Hiroden Bus runs nine buses a day between Kure and the airport , which take one hour from Kure station ( 45 minutes from Aki-Aga station ) and cost ¥ 1340 ( ¥ 2300 return , valid for seven days ) .
#Text=By train
#Text=Most passengers coming to Kure by rail come through Hiroshima , from where there are three Kure Line trains per hour during the day .
#Text=Two of these are rapid services , taking 35 minutes , while the other is local , taking 45 minutes .
#Text=Either type costs ¥ 500 .
#Text=Taking the Kure Line from Mihara to the east takes 1 hour 45 minutes and costs ¥ 1140 .
#Text=Usually a change is required at Hiro .
#Text=Going via Kaitaichi is up to 10 minutes faster , but costs an extra ¥ 350 .
#Text=The Kure Line is valid with the Japan Rail Pass , but JR West offer regional passes as a cheaper alternative to Temporary Visitors with foreign passports :
#Text=The Hiroshima-Yamaguchi Pass covers much of the JR network around Hiroshima ( as far as Miyoshi and Onomichi ) , as well as all JR stations in Yamaguchi prefecture .

#Text=It can also be used for the non-reserved seats of all San'yō Shinkansen trains ( including Nozomi and Mizuho trains ) between Mihara and Hakata , the JR Miyajima Ferry , and some local services run by Chūgoku JR Bus ( including services from Kure and Hiro stations to Saijō ) .
#Text=It lasts five days and costs ¥ 11,000 ( ¥ 12,000 if bought in Japan ) .
#Text=The Okayama-Hiroshima-Yamaguchi Pass extends the valid area to Tsuyama and Takamatsu .
#Text=It can be used on all Shinkansen trains between Okayama and Hakata .
#Text=It lasts five days and costs ¥ 13,500 ( ¥ 14,500 if bought in Japan ) .

#Text=The San'yō-San'in Pass extends the valid area still further to cover the Urban Network area of Kansai ( as far as Tsuruga and Wakayama ) , much of the San'in region , and both reserved and non-reserved seats of the Shinkansen between Shin-Osaka and Hakata .
#Text=It lasts 7 days and costs ¥ 19,000 ( ¥ 20,000 if bought in Japan ) .

#Text=The Kansai-Hiroshima Pass covers the area between Kansai and Hiroshima ( including areas of Kansai not included in the San'yō-San'in Pass , such as Shingū and Toyooka ) , but its western limit is at Iwakuni .
#Text=It can be used for non-reserved seats of all Shinkansen trains between Shin-Osaka and Hiroshima .
#Text=It lasts five days and costs ¥ 13,500 ( ¥ 14,500 if bought in Japan ) .
#Text=By bus

#Text=The Kurea Line ( operated by Hiroden Bus and Chūgoku JR Bus ) runs very frequently ( over 40 buses a day ) from central Hiroshima ( primarily the Bus Center ) , taking 40 minutes and costing ¥ 720 ( between Hiroshima Bus Center and Kure Station ) .
#Text=It does not serve Hiroshima Station ; for there , you will have to get off at Minami-kuyakusho-mae and change there for a tram .

#Text=Another option is San'yō Bus 's Kamagari-Toyohama-Yutaka Line , which runs from both the Bus Center and Hiroshima Station South Exit to some islands which lie in the Seto Inland Sea east of central Kure .
#Text=This takes 50 minutes and costs ¥ 720 to Kure Station , but runs only four times a day .
#Text=For Fukuyama and Mihara , consider taking the bus to Hiroshima Airport ( mentioned above ) and changing there .
#Text=Long-distance overnight buses are rare , partly because Kure is so close to Hiroshima .
#Text=Chūgoku JR Bus runs the Kure-Dream-Osaka-gō as a seasonal service .
#Text=It also runs ( jointly with Odakyū City Bus ) the New Breeze , which usually runs between Tokyo and Hiroshima but serves Kure in peak periods .
#Text=By ferry
#Text=Kure Central pier is next to the Yamato Museum , and 10 minutes walk from Kure Station .
#Text=The ferry service run by Seto Naikai Kisen and Ishizaki Kisen is the best way to reach Kure from Matsuyama ( and by extension much of Western Shikoku ) .

#Text=You can choose between the Superjet ( 6 services a day , taking just under an hour and costing ¥ 5550 ) and the Cruise Ferry ( 9 services a day , taking just under two hours and costing ¥ 2670 ) .
#Text=In Matsuyama , you will have to take a bus or walk 10 minutes from Takahama station on the Iyotetsu Takahama Line to reach the ferry terminal .
#Text=It is also possible to take these ferries to Hiroshima Port ; the Superjet takes 25 minutes and costs ¥ 2100 , while the Cruise Ferry takes 45 minutes and costs ¥ 930 .
#Text=Remember that you will have to change to a tram at the port to reach central Hiroshima .
#Text=See
#Text=Maritime museums
#Text=Kure has been one of the main bases for the Japanese Navy , and continues to host much of the Japanese Maritime Self Defense Force ( JMSDF ) .

#Text=In recognition of this history , the city boasts two large naval museums , which are located across the road from one another and a short walk along a covered pathway from Kure 's railway station .
#Text=JMSDF Kure Museum ( 海上自衛隊呉史料館（てつのくじら館） ) , 5-32 Takaramachi , Kure , Hiroshima prefecture ( 5 minutes walk from JR Kure Station ) .

column3: 海上自衛隊呉史料館（てつのくじら館）

column1: #Text=The museum introduces the history of JMSDF , and the historical relationship between the city of Kure and JMSDF through exhibition of historical materials concerning “ development and current status of submarines ” and “ military history and operations of minesweepers ” .
#Text=The former JMSDF submarine Akishio is on display outside the museum .
#Text=Admission free .

#Text=Kure Maritime Museum ( Yamato Museum ) ( 呉市海事歴史科学館（大和ミュージアム） ) , 5-20 Takaramachi , Kure , Hiroshima prefecture ( 5 minutes walk from JR Kure Station ) , ☏ +81 823-25-3017 , fax : +81 823-23-7400 .

column3: 呉市海事歴史科学館（大和ミュージアム）

column1: #Text=This museum is focused on the history of the World War II-era ' super battleship ' Yamato , and includes a huge one-tenth scale model of the ship .
#Text=It also has displays on the history of the Imperial Japanese Navy , most of which have English translations .
#Text=A viewing gallery on the upper stories of the museum provides a good view of the warships docked at the nearby JMSDF base .
#Text=Adults ¥ 500 , high school students ¥ 300 , elementary and junior high students ¥ 200 .
